comment: Is great with the facility and its near to MRT station. Which it just opposite the hotel.
As expected - no problems at all - everything worked fine.
not really memorable
It's a perfect Haloween Night in Singapore. I and 2 freinds went for business trip and have chance to stay in Haloween night. Such an impressive night.

last minute booking for V hotel , affordable price with central location. Taxi fare from airport to hotel in non peak hour just $18 . It is relatively value for money . Across the street, there is a food center in the public housing, the price is cheaper than the 24hour food court downstairs.
prefer to have hand shower especially for young children and bath tub would be even greater. air conditional unable to control, prefer to have fan too for children cannot take air cond

As we decided to extend one more night of our stay cation, to do our work related and project planning, i got more annoyed by the little things i did not nit pick in the past. The "dining" area which i have described in my point of view, no offense to the designer, i was shocked by the routine of the food, sushi was standard, as explained poorly by the staff there, soup in the morning was cooked, finished no more, i was taken back even more when he went to check in which one could clearly see was an empty soup cooker and once again replied no more. The food of even salads made me wonder if it was leftovers from the previous day so was the pies and pizzas. Alas, i would still recommend BIG to tourists or the locals for a one time experience, but not for a hotel that we would be going back to for awhile.

Very nice, fun and enjoy. I often to Singapore with family and We are going to come back soon. Near to public transportation, shopping and mall and food center. Nice, friendly staff and fast check in and check out.
Apart from the cockroach issue, which was later resolved swiftly by the complimentary upgrade, everything else was fine.
great value for money, location, new decor. Top choice of my great value for money hotel in Singapore!!!

Our family stayed in a club room for three nights. The two beds in the room fit three of us confortably. You can walk into Bugis mall from one of hotel doors. There are so many restaurants in the mall as well as on the streets. The hotel decor is based on an old shopping-story setting.
Strongly satisfy and highly recommended. the room is large, bath room is large and well equipped. the bed is large and comfortable. Cleanliness is well done. The room design is beautiful.

The experience is bad considering the price we paid. The room is partially renovated with wallpaper coming off. The toilet is small with 80's decoration. A big sink in a relatively small toilet space.

Not as grand as a 5-star hotel but given its location it's alright. Lobby is on 4/F which you need to get up from 1/F, a small floor with no facilities except a lounge with dirty sofas. However all staffs are nice. The lights are relatively dim inside the room even all on. Room service was fast.
The stay was good, but the hotel is not anymore a 5 star hotel. Needs renovation/upgrade to deserve the five star
As a past guest of the Goodwood Park we decided to return for a special family celebration. It didn't let us down...just as lovely as ever.
Disappointed, swimming pool was small, club floor cocktail food was just normal. breakfast café is always crowded with so many people & very crimpy.

the bed is large but the mrt is a bit far. clean. staff attidue fair. good for shopping as it's located at the most famous shopping distrcit - orchid. however, the hotel is at the end of the district so you get prepared to walk a bit.
This hotel is located a bit far from the city center, many restaurant around but not so convenience to the shopping area. near MRT station abount 10 mins walk
This is an older hotel with a classic feel. A terrific location...close to Orchard road and an easy walk to the MRT.
Highly recommend this hotel for business or vacation purposes. Grand Park offers a very good service & comfortable athmosphere. A very well managed hotel. Would love to come back in the future.
Pleasant and comfortable. Close to Orchard road and clarke quay.

Very good to excellent. All staff encountered were very friendly & eager to assist. Location is very good, although a little off the beaten path. However public transport is very good, with the nearest MRT station 300 metres a level walk away.
A nice and clean hotel. more than i expected. i got free and safe parking. very convinience to the hotel. the room is tidy and clean, very comfortable.
Althought the room is small, however, it is still a comfortable stay. The plus point is the location where it is near shopping malls.
the hotel has got access to MRT where you can reach to Orchard road within 5 minutes. A room is nice with large window and you can enjoy city/mountain view from the room.

The overall stay I would say is good . I chose to stay here due to the budget for the room it provides is budget. After a day at the USS a nice room was the perfect choice to sooth the tiredness of the day spent . The bed was comfy not too soft or too hard . The bathroom was clean with a nice design . Room was large at its price compare to others . A small hiccup appeared , the staff who checks the mini bar item came which I did not expect .Ring the doorbell a while and open the door by herself as I am approaching the door , got a shock. Even request to come in which I rejected as I am not fully dress so were my girlfriend . This incident makes the stay not so good overall. Thus I did not give a high rating for its staff unprofessional behavior .The stay is overall good with all my requests being met when mentioned.

The food at the Hotel was outstanding. Breakfast at the courtyard cafe was always a joy. The bed was comfortable and the room was clean. The staff were especially attentive. I would like to return, it is in an excellent location.

Though it's centrally located, we were shocked at the long queue at the hotel reception upon our arrival. A long queue was snaking for check-in. There was only a single queue (perhaps to ensure first-come-first-serve service). When we entered the hotel room, the spacious room welcomed us. However, I must say that the bathroom facilities need to be maintained. The shower control got detached while I was trying to turn the shower on. Perhaps because of its location, this is a popular hotel amongst tourists and businessmen alike. This is the most crowded hotel swimming pool I have ever seen ! And so, if you are looking for a place to relax and enjoy some peace, this may not be the best place to go..
it was a pleasant stay. thanks the management and people whom worked there, room is clean and checking in was quick.

First, I want to thank the customer relationship for helping us to check into rooms as early as they could. The room, bathroom and bath tub was so spacious. Nice view facing the Adventure Cove waterpark. All the staff there was very helpful and courteous, we felt so Comfortable and Enjoyed alot during the stay.

I was disspaointed with our room. The room was not their best, though I assume there are much better rooms in the hotel. I paid this price as I thought we would have difficulty securing a hotel room for 2 nights and friends had planned to stay there. I wont book this hotel again based on my experience this time. The bathroom blinds over the bath were mouldy as was the grout in the bathroom. There was an open drain in the bathroom, we covered it with a towel and in the morning bugs flew out of it when it was removed. The bugs were on our towels, and many other places. The shower rail was rusty, the tap was rusty also in the sink. Obviously we were not given a great room - I don't know if this is because of who I booked through. The staff did not pick up for the SkyView restaurant/bar at all. I rang the concierge, they put me through but the phone just rang. I rang the front desk, they said oh just go up there. We chose that for dinner as we were quite tired. We told them that we were there to eat. They let us order drinks and then after 20 minutes we sat down only to be told we'd have to wait 20 - 30 mins for our meals. I wish they had told us that to start with I would have ordered and then been happy to have my cocktail and wait. These are not huge issues, but I travel a lot and there are many more hotels out there doing things smarter and better. I will be unlikely to book here again. We stayed at the another hotel last time in Singapore and we're still talking about that experience. There is nothing from this stay I'd care to remember.
The brief weekend stay was a delight. Enjoying the full Hotel services and convenience of a relaxing Spa environment. A Highly recommended treat!

On arrival we unloaded all the bags, stroller and baby.. No bell boys to assist and so we struggled up to the level 5 lobby... Took ages to check-in as the staff were busy. We soon discovered that the staff are always busy and its best to use the phone for any service. The room they first gave us was very average, it was old and had a bad feel about it. They switched us to a new room, which had a better feel, better design and better bathroom with a separate shower and bath. Everything else was ok, except the breakfast. The buffet breakfast was way below standard for a hotel of this standard. Limited choices, poor quality and only refilled dishes on request.
A comfortable stay for a classy hotel. We were not disturbed by the renovations going on. We were delighted by the attentiveness of the staff.

the deal is good because the room stays come w free tickets to adventure cove. sea aquarium and universal studios. is a good Couples time together in sentosa. rooms are ok. not ery very lavish nor new but comfortable enough.
Staff was helpful in resolving parking fee issue without a fuss (complemntary parking ticket did not work and was refunded promptly) and offered good advise on parking and shopping.
Very happy with the facilities and central location close to the CBD. Room was good sized area and kept very clean.
I was just passing through SIngapore. I've stayed here before an enjoyed the location so well that keep returning.
good location , the hotel is clean amd with a good price to be in the best shopping area of Singapore .

My stay was quite a good one with hotel staffs very good service orientated and helpful, easy accessibility with night shopping and entertainment just around the corner. I personally feel that though the room is quite spacious and clean but I find that the bath tub curtain smelly and unable to withstand the aroma of the bath tub curtain.
stay at grand park orchard is always a good experience the only thing the price now is more and more expensive and need to include breakfast as compliment not an additional.
We stayed at the hotel for 5 nights. Everything is OK except the room is rather small for a five star hotel.
Relaxing stay with plenty of shopping along Orchard belt. Great Christmas lighting and festive atmosphere. Fantastic restaurants in the vicinity. The MRT is just a short walk away.

No major complaint. A nice hotel to stay in . However when I was there for a swim, there is no staff stationed at the counter. There is also no single towel at the counter and a guest had to call in requesting for towels. Male toilet at the swimming pool is in total darkness as the light sensors are not working. Swimming pool water was a bit too cold for comfortable. For a 5 star hotel, these type of issue should be avoided.

The stay was fun.we got a large double room with a very nice view of sentosa.the hotel's location was also superb as it was only 5mins walking distance to uss,s.e.a and the adventure cove waterpark.we also got complimentary admission tickets to all 3 places which was a plus to our stay.the people at the reception were helpful and the concierge were such nice people.they were ready to attend to all your needs. However there were also some downsides of the hotel.first,the buffet breakfast was the same everyday.there's not much variety considering what people had to pay for.the hotel also didnt offer free internet.it sucks that they charged an hour usage of internet for 5.35sgd.i think its a rip off.

It was a pleasant stay. I was there on a business trip, the hotel is nearby my consultant's office. Many food/restaurant nearby, so it is easy to get dinner. There are convenience stores in the same building as the hotel (a 7-11 and Guardian). Recommended for business trip, as the ricing is also not expensive.
Pretty good except the single mattress was a bit small and a bit hard and the place was a bit far from the MRT
Overall we had a good stay. The room is spacious and the bed is comfortable. My only feedback is the slow checkin and checkout. Its the slowest I encountered in numerous hotels I stayed in Singapore.
Good and peaceful. 10mins walking distance from mrt.

It was a good hotel to stay in. Very convenient as there are many shops nearby. Easily accessible by public transport. Nice swimming pool. Free wifi access. I would recommend this hotel to travelers who are looking for night life and for families as well.

I had a great one-night stay at Hotel Michael. The location was very ideal and convenient for my itinerary which was to have fun at all the attractions in the area. Being a fan of Michael Graves, I was more than happy to experience a stay at this boutique hotel. What made it an even more satisfying was its living up to its five-star status: comfortable, high-end rooms & amenities paired with the attentive,friendly and helpful staff.
IT WAS GREAT, Rizza was excellent in checking me in and provided all the info I needed. The staff are superb and the management has got a team. I will recommend it to my friends and colleagues.
Very Enjoyable hotel but prefer the garden view to city view

Overall I will rate this hotel to be excellent for the business traveler. The front desk were very friendly people and this hotel is located at the heart of the city so we are accessible to every tourist spot in Singapore

The check in was smooth. The room was clean except that the pillow was too soft for comfort. Bathroom looks a bit outdated and the bathtub was kind of stuck. Water did not flow to the drain as fast as it could.

the room was very clean, as it is a quite new hotel, there is small shopping center, located next to the hotel, great local food around the hotel, the only disadvantage is that you can hear sound on on the room, maybe because the wall is to thin.
The stays was great. A good place for family holiday but it doesn't include breakfast.

Our stay at Sentosa -Equarius Hotel was a very pleasant, comfortable and most enjoyable one. Our room was fantastic, a very comfortable bed and a big luxurious bathroom. The staff were very friendly and helpful,and we would have loved to stay there for a week instead of our 4 days we had.
Beautiful，Graceful，Clean， Convenient， Comfortable.

Overall, a pleasant stay as the location is very close to shopping centres jsut a 5 minutes walk to Bugis Junction (cinema etc). The room was large (Deluxe room), room and toilet is clean. Except for the air-con is doesnt work quite well. :(
Good location which is very near to Universal Studio Singapore, Adventure Cove Waterpark and Sea Aquarium. The 3 days 2 night package is totally worth it and value for money.

The hotel is an easy access from the airport. Check-in and Check-out were smooth. It is located within walking distance to Little India, Orchard Road (if you don't mind the humid weather, if not just take the MRT). The hotel is also surrounded by a lot of restaurants and finding halal restaurant is not an issue. There are a few halal restaurants within 100 meter from the hotel. We tried food at the Albert Centre Food Court...it's cheap and delicious :). The room is just nice for two light travelers. Will stay here again if I come back to the city.

It was relaxing and stress-free. A great place for staycation as the hotel is situated at one corner of Orchard which is rather quiet. We had a great time relaxing from work and preparation for the arrival of our baby. On top of that, it was our wedding anniversary and a nice cake was delivered to our room for celebration.
It was fantastic and definitely keep us coming back next time
Tiny room, embarrassing small bath room, good bed. Probably the worst 4 star hotel in Singapore.

My second time in this hotel, one of the best experience ever in Singapore, rooms are beautiful, pool outstanding and very quiet while in the center of the city, of course you must pay the price for that.

Overall the hotel is ok, but compare with other 3 hotels, hard rock, festiver, Hotel michael, our hotel equarius is more far and no easy to access to universal studio and marine park... when we go out must need wait for the shuttle bus services, and the shuttle bus services untill 9:30 PM only. If Parents need go to casino, this is very troublesome. Another one I was very satisfied with the hotel since there is no free wifi services. Compare with i stay at other hotel at marina bay 5* they have provied free wifi services...
Pros: Good Location.. Very Big Rooms. Staff are helpful.. Near Orchard Road.. Cons: A little expensive.. No breakfast.. Unexpected payments. Far from mrt/lrt stations

I had a wonderful stay at the Capella during the March school holiday weekend. Check in was smooth and staff was attentive. I was captivated by the room as it was huge and I liked the uber huge windows with the day bed beside it, and how the bed is facing the window. Sadly, my room was to the side of the entrance and there was not much of a privacy as whoever who walks towards the lobby will get to see our room. The pool was fantastic although I didn't get to swim. The only grievance from my mother was that the water pressure in the shower was too low. We also couldn't find a sockets that are mounted higher on the wall. We had to place the kettle on the floor. Otherwise, I really loved it and would love to return next year :) Thumbs up for the disabled friendly toilet too
it was a very relaxing and well spent one night stay!

We thoroughly enjoyed our stay in a beautiful room. We had a very comfortable king size bed and the room was decorated with style but subtle. Large marble bathroom. This must be one of the few luxury hotels in Singapore where some of the rooms have balconies. We were in the new wing with a balcony overlooking the neighbouring property gardens. Room had tea/coffee facilities, bathrobes, safe, hair dryer, free bottles of water. I love this hotel. We did not have time to test out the restaurants and other facilities of the hotel so I cannot comment on fitness centre etc.

Just finished a staycation over at Swissotel the Stamford. Booked a grand room, but not as grand as expected. Kudos to the friendly service staff who gave us a high floor. One major downside which I found most apalling is that there is no complimentary parking at all. Which meant that i had to fork out a ton of money just for parking my car there for 2 days. Would not recommend this place for a staycation if u are driving.
Fantastic hotel, a must stay for everyone. We will definitely be back again
Good service,friendly staff, cleanliness hotel, on the other hand, they have a lot of trainee student

The room is very nice and the staffs are very friendly. The breakfast is very nice with a lot of foods, from Asian to western foods. A good place to stay in Singapore for shopping because very near to a lot of shopping center that popular in orchard area. Easy access to other places because very near to MRT station.

The room is very nice and the staffs are very friendly. The breakfast is very nice with a lot of foods, from Asian to western foods. A good place to stay in Singapore for shopping because very near to a lot of shopping center that popular in orchard area. Easy access to other places because very near to MRT station.

It's great. It's a good choice of hotel we have made. We plan to go to Johor Bahru, Malaysia by bus. The bus station is apparently right across the street in front of the hotel! The hotel is next to the MRT station and Bugis Junction mall is really close by too. In short, it's a great 3 days stay in the hotel and bugis area.
A nice hotel with standard services. A very good location for those on business trip as well for vacation (shopping).

In the starting when we arrived it was little bumpy as we didnot get early checking inspite of asking that from past 1 week and also ready to pay. I need to move my parents to my friend house for the first few hours. I booked this hotel for its location, quite close to MRT and near to all the major singapore attractions and shopping area. The room was clean and also the staff was nice. we stayed for 5 days and it was a pleasant stay for my parents, as most of the time we were not in the hotel but still no complaints abt the same. Only the thing is it is little pricy.

waited rather long to check in even though I arrived well after standard check in hours. Left my computer mouse in the room and did not realised it. It would be good that the hotel makes the effort to contact guest proactively to return items left behind. Other than that, the room was nice and comfortable. Spacious as well. I won't mind returning another time.
it was near by to the shopping area, just a few minutes walk. highly recommended for shopping lovers. but the toilet cleanliness can be improve...
It was a perfect "stay-cation" for me and my family. We loved the surrounding area, the atmosphere the hotel exudes was a truly relaxing one. The staff there were both attentive and efficient.

I enjoyed my stay. Met my expectations. I will obviously recommend this to my friends.The best was the add-on $100++ to upgrade my room to suite, the comfortable bed and large room and not to forget the city view.
Even though it was a 2 days 1 night staycation, the staff are friendly and also very fast check in & check out.

We have a comfortable and very pleasant stay . The only problem we encountered was the lift which was very crowded when we checked out which the bell boy had a little difficulty to transport our luggage to the ground floor while we had to waited for quite a while.
The hotel provided well for all my needs during the stay.

A short but pleasant stay. The centrally situated location allows easy access to shopping, restaurants and sight seeing locations. The easy access of public transport also allows convenience around Singapore. Hotel is recommended for business and holiday travelers - whether travelling alone or with family.
Everything is okay except the breakfast, taste not to standard. To be improved.

We arrived in the afternoon nad were greeted by the guest relation who drove us in a hotel buggy to our rooms. The whole hotel is secluded from the outside world and seems to be a paradise away from the hustle & bustle of a typical city, like Singapore. The 3 bed room apartment we stayed in was spacious and very clean. It came with full facilities. The staff were kind to permit us to check out late the following day.
Hotel was centrally located, easy access to public transport, room was nice and cleam

strongly recommend.I've heard a lot about the hotel rooms in Singapore are quite small.To my surprise,my room is quite nice.It has great windows and you can get a nice view of Bugis.The service is efficient.Don't forget that the hotel is only 300 meters away from the Bugis MRT station and really close to the shopping malls and Bugis street.really convenient.
Besides the strange lobby that most taxi drive have no clue about... Overall the stay is great.
We stayed in the comfort of a four star hotel. We asked for interconnected rooms, so we can keep contact with our two children, and got a free upgrade.
We enjoyed it very much and will come back again. The location is excellent near the MRT station, shops and restaurants. The room is clean & comfortable.

We love the newly refurnished room. It was perfect for us. However during check-in the staff wasn't really attentive and probably because I couldn't comprehend what she was trying to say it made the whole experience slightly dissatisfying. Overall a pleasant stay. Would definitely come again.

the room we stayed is cosy and spacious. the hotel is conveniently located next to bugis junction- which is great for shopping and dining. the overall ambience of the hotel is also pleasant and nice.
Sightseeing/Attractions Tip: If you walk further beyond Bugis + shopping mall, there is a local food centre where one can sample nice local dishes.

We did not get to experience everything at this hotel as we were only there for two days but we would recommend it to our friends. The staff went over and above when it came to assistance e.g. making a phone call on our behalf, when a tour we had booked was late. The receptionist had no hesitation when we asked for a later check out on the day we were leaving. The wonderful men on the door were so efficient in there service, providing a taxi or helping with luggage. We definitely left with a smile on our face and would stay there again.

I surprised my pregnant wife with a styacation at Hard Rock Hotel for a double celebration of our 1st wedding anniversary, and her birthday. Had a 2 nights stay and the hotel was overall slightly above satisfactory. Though we did not dine at the hotel itself (there are plenty of dining places around Resorts World Sentosa and the Sentosa island itself), we did use the pool facilities and would have loved to use the gym if we had brought our workout gear. Staff were friendly from check in. We were surprised with an anniversary cake in our room upon check in. I have to however be slightly disappointed with the housekeeping service. Having not left our room for breakfast, we had the Do Not Disturb light on in the morning. When we left for brunch, we called housekeeping to request for the room to be made up. 3 hours later when we returned, the room was still not cleaned up. We had to wait an hour at the lobby, during which I went up twice to check on the room, but it was still not done. It was 4 hours after the first request before our room was cleaned up by houskeeeping. Pool was great, but could get slightly crowded with kids as neighbouring hotel guests are also allowed in.

It was quite a relaxed stay, I was probably tired from my flight and slept through the whole stay till morning. It was comfy,a bit noisy from the outside as people walked by open and cloing the door, that kinda woke me up bit. Overall, pleasant.

Oasia Hotel is lockated in a nice neighbourhood, next to a shopping mall. A metro stadion is just downstairs, a few steps from the hotel. The room we had was rather big and the bathroom too. No meals were included, but the mall has several restaurants and cafes. It only took about fine minutes by tube to Ochard Road. It was also easy to use buses to get into Little India, for example. The pool area was nice and not too crowded. All in all, the hotel was a positive experience and I will certainly recommend it.
It was a quick stay and the rooms are large and comfortable.
We had a very good relaxing weekend in the quiet surroundings. The hotel has a great SPA with very experienced masseurs. Limited in-room dining choices after midnight.
quiet and away from the noisy shopping areas but still centrally located. Breakfast was tasty and have a good selection of hot dishes. staff was friendly and helpful.
Pleasant stay with friendly staff. Not very close to other RWS hotels (which are closer to Universal Studios) but next to Adventure Cove Water Park.
Pleasant and relaxed. Ideal for a stopover. Quiet and well appointed rooms. Attentive but unobtrusive staff with old world (70's) charm.
We had a view overlooking the adventure cove. Room was too comfortable that we couldnt bear to leave the place.

After we came back to our room, we found the complementary cake and an anniversary card handwritten-ed by the hotel manager waiting for us. After switching on the TV, we found beautiful personalized blessing for our anniversary on the screen. We were very impressed with those heartwarming greetings. We were offered to upgrade our room type to club house room with just minimal charge. Even though, we hardly use the facility but it gave us a speedy check-in and check-out. Refreshment was available for us all day thru and the staffs were really welcoming. The direct access to MRT and the short walking distance to nearby shopping malls give this hotel a really plus point. But even without all that convenience, we would gladly go back there again. The hotel design and the cleanliness are up to the standard advertised by the hotel. Overall, we really enjoy our times there. Esp. for those travelling with kids, their staffs were really friendly and helpful toward my 4-yr-old boy.

The hotel is not at city center and so the traffic noise & jam are avoided. Though not at city center, it is not far away from the major shopping or business areas - relatively convenient if you travel by taxi

It was a very nice and comfortable hotel to stay in. The room was huge, big bathroom. Breakfast was quite good. Near to other attractions as it is situated within Resorts World Sentosa. The only downside is it is rather far away from these attractions, and usually you have to take the shuttle bus provided. Still, it's away from the hustle and bustle of the attractions which is good if you like the quiet. It is also located beside ESPA so spa services are nearby.

Our stay was very relax. Perhaps they can provide more games/toys in the kids room for the little ones to enjoy. Food wise, not much variety around the hotel unless you take the shuttle bus further into town.

umm. so far so good cause i booked this hotel for low price, but would not like to visit again. breakfast was not included which I was able to find after booking process.. and i paid extra charge for it but... food quality was disapointing. swimming pool was only thing that seemed enjoyable but, it was blocked due to rain. So there was not much facility to enjoy lol... anyway... environment around hotel is nice though..
Nothing special about the hotel but just thought the quality of interior furniture was not exactly the price I would have paid for.

Arrived in the evening directly from airport after work. The quick check in was a blessing as i was exhausted already. The room was ready and clean meeting my expectation. Have option to exclude breakfast as i was heading to conference next morning. The facility in the hotel was good. Taxi available at lobby to send me conference venue and airport.

We enjoyed every moment at this hotel starting with the greeting at the lobby with friendly professional staff (including being escorted to our upgraded junior suite). We mentioned our anniversary and on the day we received a delicious cake in our room and at the restaurant that evening they spoiled us again. The food and drinks are definitely not cheap but for a special occasion we felt pampered and the food was delicious. We had 2 large bathrooms in our suite, a lovely king sized bed, a lounge room and plenty of space. The only (very small)complaint was that the lighting in the bathroom was too subtle for putting on make up! We enjoyed the smaller pool for relaxing as it was secluded and in a very attractive setting.
Pleasant and I like the big and spacious room, not forgetting the comfy bed.
It was enjoyable and pleasant stay else I won't come back so often !!!

overall the room was nice and tidy. Dressing table was well designed and its a nice place for getaway. Just that the adjourning door was disturbing as the guest next room keep trying to pry open the door thinking it was a secret access place. ;P
booked for a family deluxe room for 3 people, but the room was so tiny and not even big enough to fit a Couples. It took 15 minutes to walk to public transport. Only benefit is closed to food hall.
This hotel is all about the swimming pool (unless you're a gambler, I suppose). Everything else is fantastic but it is staying here is all about the incredible, jaw-dropping, awesome, swimming pool.

the capella is a truly fantastic hotel. it is unique in that it has the luxury of an aman resort with the proximity to the city which would even suit a busy business traveller. the experience is hard to fault, but if being hyper critical, i'd say that the in room dining could be slightly more inspired. even though cassia is a fine restaurant, it did not travel too well.
Perfect,romantic,lots of attractions,near to shopping,easy access to town area.
It was a very present experience staying at swissotel. This is my second time staying at this hotel. The hotel rooms are very clean and spacious. The location of the hotel is very convinent

I stayed for one night only in a room with city view. The room is big and has a small balcony. I could see the bustling city in the morning after I got up. Centrally located and convenient to go any place of interests.

I stayed for one night only. Quick check-in experience. Bus stops just a Couples of steps in front and on the side of hotel. 2 minutes walk to MRT Yellow Line station. I didn't have breakfast at hotel, so visited Kopitiam on the adjacent building. Spacious room for the price I'm paying. Clean, complete amenities. Felt like staying at 5 star hotel. Free wifi! Cons: a bit long waiting for taxi

Not very pleasant ... though ive stayed in this hotel a few times before they couldnt find my record ... Hotel atmosphere was kind of choking with a very distinct strong smell in the lobby area. The staffs were friendly but somehow the 'fakeness' was very evident ...

It was good on the whole but the room needed a bit of upgrading.The bathroom had a strange window into the bedroom with a blind that had to be pulled down over the bath but which did not appear to be waterproof for the shower!The location was excellent and it was an added bonus that they stored the luggage after check out for a late evening flight and mad showers available after a day sightseeing before flying out.
Very nice, comfortable room and super clean. It is very close to mrt station and direct access to novena square.

We loved our large room with two bathrooms. The size of the hotel was not too large therefore more friendly and intimate. The Gordon Grill was supurb and the staff were extremely helpful and friendly. Next time we go to Singapore we will definitely stay at the Goodwood Park Hotel and suggest it to other friends. It was suggested to us by a friend.

Me & family enjoyed our 3 day stay. Near train station, food outlets, bugis junction shopping complex. Also very near to bugis village & Arab street where u can buy almost anything from electronic to accessories to souvenirs.

Oasia Hotel did not fail me. It met all my expectations. The hotel was very clean, the rooms comfortable to stay in, and although it was not located in Orchard, it was very accessible because the hotel was right near an mrt station. I would definitely stay here again when I go back to Singapore.

The stand out quality of this hotel is its staff - they were friendly and professional at all times. My room requests were all met on check in and check in was a quick and smooth process. The room is nothing special - pretty standard but decent size, clean and functional. The city view from the room I had was great . The carpet is a bit worn in the corridors. Internet connection in the room was excellent. The hotel is connected to the MRT (train) system which is really handy for daytime travel. The restaurants in velocity mall, a few steps from the hotel entrance, are also good and cheap for lunch/early dinner or tea. The only thing I did not like about this hotel was its not so central location. It is about a 10-15 minutes drive to parts of the CBD and located in the hospital district which has absolutely no nightlife. I would reccommend staying closer to the city centre if you like to party at night. Perfect for those who will use the MRT only and not go out a night. I found the taxis in singapore reasonable priced (around 15 Singapore dollars to get from CBD areas to Hotel which is not bad). Overall a very good stay.
Good stay except poor Internet service. Unable to conduct business.
Its was a good vacation for me & my wife. A room refrigerator was missed badly.

We stayed at the Equarius for a night. We are very impressed with the size of the room, the cleanliness and the quiet surrounding. However it is pretty far to walk to the Resort World Sentosa/USS area and we have to rely on the shuttle service operated by the resort. If you are travelling with an infant or toddlers, i would highly recommend you to stay at the Festive Hotel instead.

We stayed at the Equarius for a night. We are very impressed with the size of the room, the cleanliness and the quiet surrounding. However it is pretty far to walk to the Resort World Sentosa/USS area and we have to rely on the shuttle service operated by the resort. If you are travelling with an infant or toddlers, i would highly recommend you to stay at the Festive Hotel instead.

great experience. The room is very nice, modern and clean. Staffs there are very friendly as well. The location is good as there are cinema,shopping center etc. nearby. After 10-15 mins walk from the hotel, u will arrive at Orchard rd where is famous for shopping. MRT is very near as we'll and easy to get a taxi there too.
A very nice, clean hotel. Staff were friendly. Not in the centre of Singapore near Orchard Rd, but only 2 stops on the train.

This hotel is located very close to everything in city centre. Everything is in walking distance. This time I was upgraded to a very comfortable room; it was spacious and clean. I am very satisfied. The swimming pool is very nice. The hotel is very big. You may easy to get lost if this was your first time here. In general, I like this hotel and will come to stay here again for my next business meeting here in Singapore.

It was a wonderful staycation. We book the room and I requested for a level 3 garden view room as it has a garden right outside your room. It is a good venue to request for these room if you had alot of people and it's great place to hold any party.

I have always put my guests visiting Singapore in another hotel downtown and only selected this hotel as that one was fully booked. It turned out to be a very pleasant surprise. The hotel is housed in a classic building that has been beautifully renovated and the room itself has a high ceiling. It's nicely decorated, very clean and bathroom is a delight. Staff service is one of the best I have ever encountered anywhere in the world. Love this hotel!
Very interesting stays with an android device to control room lighting! Amazing!
staying in this hotel with kids was really fun. kids enjoyed the room. big room with sofa. vety relaxing experience.
The hotel provided a relaxing, comfortable and affordable stay.

I stayed here for 2 nights. This hotel location is good. It is near orchard road, 15 mins by walk. The room is large with good design. From the balcony you can see the city view. I can concluded that my stay here is valued in money.

booked the one bedroom villa as a surprise for my partner on 21st april 2012! the hotel was very kind as to allow an early check-in for me to prepare the room for her. the manager even wrote a personal welcome note thanking us for choosing capella. was very pleased with that. place was clean and nice smelling. very prompt with room service (we asked for extra blankets and pillows) they took about 5mins or less to arrive at our room with our requests. loved the place, already missing it! there was a library at the lobby as well that served ace cookies. couldn't stop snacking on them!

Overall satisfied, convinient to public transport and affordable rate. Staff is friendly. Walking distance to public area eg. shopping and food and beverages.Room cleanliness and housekeeping is satisfied. Beside has a very big and nice swimming pool. Chinese restaurants inside hotel is very convinient for dining. Near to fresh market as well as we can try real local food. Also working distance to night market nearby Bugis junction. A good experience stay and will consider in our future trip to Singapore to stay again there.
Above average since it is centrally located with free breakfast...

Stay was the best in a long time, I checked in with the wrong dates but the Duty manager used his own initiative and mobile phone to call Agoda and spoke to them to resolve it. Agoda did not penalize me and allowed me to check in without penalty, my stay was very comfortable and enjoyable

My stay at the Marina Bay Sands was most enjoyable. The rooms were extremely clean, the staff was very nice and informative, the food was great, there were many stores available, it was near a nice mall with a very diverse food court and the subway had a stop at the hotel. Everything about my stay there was great. You won't find a better hotel in the city.

This hotel is propably singapore's best. High price but every cent worth it. Very friendly service, spacious rooms, amazing landscape and pools and very quiet unlike resort world or city hotels. Best choice in singapore! We will definitely come back!

Such a lovely hotel. The facilities are amazing! We stayed in Singapore to celebrate our anniversary. The hotel staff left us a lovely note, as well putting us in a room with a beautiful view. We booked a club room - and it was well worth it. The rooms are big and comfortable. The bed is one of the most comfortable beds I've ever slept on! Toiletries are provided - you won't need to bring anything with you. Mini bar is always stocked with soft drinks and fresh water. Housekeeping was amazing. I don't think I have ever seen such a clean hotel. Great range of options for breakfast. Western and Asian with food options changing daily. Facilities are fantastic - the club level pool is gorgeous. The gym is very well equipped.. Including towels and water bottles The staff are lovely, very knowledgable and eager to help. The location of this hotel is a little out of the main tourist area, something to consider if you're looking to be right in the thick of it. Personally we enjoyed the location and found all our destinations could be easily accessed by the MRT with Novena station accessible from the hotel. There are two huge shopping malls with a supermarket and many cafés/ fast food outlets. An FYI the zoo is a pain to get to by bus and train.. We caught a taxi from the hotel for $16 My only criticism of this pretty much perfect hotel is that there were quite a few small children on the club level.. But for some people that might be a positive. The only other negative is that there was so much to see in is beautiful city that we didn't spend nearly enough time in the hotel! This could be the best hotel we've ever stayed in!
Absolutely relaxing & fun for the kids. Spacious & clean room accomodations.

The location was good, the hotel is a bit older, and the staff was not particularly friendly. It was acceptable, but I have stayed at better hotels in Singapore. I decided to try the hotel based upon location, and was not disappointed in that regard.
Was given a large room but on a smoking floor. Room cleanliness was poor. Otherwise hotel was ok
As long as one does not have breakfast it is an ok hotel. Breakfast is substandard and staff not friendly. However, room cleaning staff r very helpful and friendly. Front desk ok.

Actually, I'm not satisfied with the level of cleanliness because there is always some stain on either the toilet bowl or bath tub even after I requested the housekeeping to clean. and the room is too cold and can't be adjust. Good thing about Amara is that staff quite friendly. They change the room upon my request and provide free Wi-fi during mt stay.

Acceptable hotel room and friendly staffs. It's close to Bugis Junction to go for shopping and there's a lot of food to eat there. The hotel room is big and comfy. Love the cosiness and the cable tv. But its overpriced for a one night stay. $300plus and you dont get breakfast buffet, no bathtub in the toilet. Kind of disappointed.
Overall was a good one. But the staffs are abit slow when they are full house. They should learn to deal with such crowds coming in.

Is a pleasant stay, walking distance to ICA. Located near bugis village and junction, great shopping area within walking distance less than 5 mins. In addition local food like roti prata are just across the street. As for transportation are within the proxy. Simply good location.

fast check in and check out. very effecient concierge... although the room was quite small for the price. i paid for one extra bed. i thought there was room enough but there wasnt.the room was not as impressive as i have expected considering that it was resorts world... but the design of the bathroom was very unique.
It was away from the crowd yet easily accessible and very near the shopping areas
Good service and an exciting memorable holiday that i ever had

We enjoyed our stay here, the room was not too big but comfortable, we had free wifi and there was a fridge. Limited channels on the cable TV though, as my toddler was looking for Disney Junior haha! The hotel is also very accessible via taxi, a bus stop is 2mins walk away, Bugis Junction is 10mins away, there is a 7-11 and local resto at the ground floor.

The hotel is very accessible, it is near The stations of different mrt lines of singapore. -- Close to shopping places and other places of interest - The staff was very accomodating and helpful, friendly too - breakfast is buffet, there are lots of food choices - Room is big and comfortable
fast & early check-in, fast checkout; good, homey breakfast; big rooms; far from orchard rd.& bus station but accessible to taxis; quiet, decent area
Staff is very accommodating, even giving me upgrade to much nicer room! Nice gym too overlooking the pool!

Actually near the Shopping Area, and whenever the Room is Over for Standard/Deluxe Room, the Receiptionist will give Upgrade to Suite Room. It makes comfort. For the Condition of the Room is already looked Old, it makes not feeling comfortable for some of the Visitors.
Adequate. Just adequate . Staff not very helpful or friendly.

It was alright, the room could have been cleaner. There were ant problems. The shower was very small and there was no shower curtain. The floor therefore got easily wet. This is OK if you're just going to get in and out of the hotel to go places. It is definitely NOT a luxury hotel.

Received warm welcome once we reached the hotel. Really impressed by the tree pool. The view from top to the pool and the surroundings was spectacular. The library is a nice place to relax, read, and tea. They provide compliment refreshments. I love the dessert like creme brûlée, homemade cookies and chocolates, fruits and the beverage bar with quality tea bags. The best thing is that you will never need to show your key card except to open the gym room door. The lighting and air-con can be adjusted with a high tech digital panel near the bed. The pool is the best place for photos. And when we were swimming on a sunny day. A staff gave each of us one choc ice-cream ball coated with chocolate! Really delicious and so sweet of him. We haven't had a drink at the bar but the environment is nice especially at night. It is spacious. We saw a male peacock at the garden on the floor where the lobby situates. I love the room. A double bed plus a couch large enough for 2 ppl. The bathroom looks neat and I especially like the white round chair where you can relaxingly sit on to blow your hair or makeup. The only disadvantage is the location. It is not close from the closest Sentosa Express Imbiah Station. We walked for 20 minutes from it to the hotel when we didn't take cab. They offer shuttle buses to and fro Vivo City but the last one is from 5:45pm on weekdays. Overall, I very much love this hotel and if possible will come back! Highly recommend.
relaxing, but its quite hard to get a taxi in the morning

the relc is very good for those wanting to have a good place to stay with family- i got a room with 2 queen beds which is very comfortable for a family -2 adults and 2 kids. the only thing that i wish can be improved is a shuttle to transport to the nearest stop or tourist attractions. we had to walk to the near hotel shangrila and hitch a ride to universal. the hotel is isolated and we are left on our own to walk to near areas. shuttle provision would be good.

Worth the price we paid. The room is spacious , clean & comfortable . The staff are very friendly and helpful . Location very convenient because it's only 4-10 mins walk to major shopping malls & MRT station. Nice restaurant outside the hotel area too.
large room, comfortable bed, close to attractive location, affordable price!
LARGE BED LARGE ROOM AFFORDABLE PRICE CLOSE TO ORCHARD ROAD, WILL RECOMMEND TO FRIENDS

Great overall. Good price for the quality being offered. Downstairs as mentioned in the past reviews are the food stalls and a Kopitiam. Just across the medium-sized street to the side is the Lavender MRT so 10/10 for transport. Staff downstairs are very polite for Singaporean standard so an extra plus there. Free 30mins internet on lobby for guess and thats great enough for traveler like me.

We are locals who wanted to spend a weekend in the city since it was my companion's birthday. Location was pretty good considering most hotels in the city or near MRT stations usually cost a bomb. Just 5-10 mins walk to shopping and Bugis MRT and we could even walk to Plaza Singapura. Pleasant surprise upon checking when they threw in free breakfast, which turned out to be quite good! Small rooms but since we were out most of the time, we didn't mind. Had issues with the air con, and they promptly got it fixed while we were out. If standards and rates maintain, and good promotions available, I will be back!

The room overall is ok, bathroom is clean, bed is quite hard but good to my liking. The rooms are good for a short stay. You can find food easily 24hrs nearby, there is a Kopitiam - open 24 hrs. There are 7/11, Wendy's, Subway, Starbucks and Coffee Bean is also near the hotel, less than 5 minutes walking. Bus station and MRT Bras Basah/Dhoby Ghaut is just a walk away. Taxis are easy to find, the concierge will help you to get it. The location was across the road from the MRT so was convenient to travel around Singapore. Breakfast was good and catered for various nationalities. The gym was a bit dated but good enough for a short stay.
Only swimming pool has no attendent on duty most of the time.
Very good. No frills but reached good serviceability

The stay was just close to perfect. The only downside is the nearest public transport (Bus or MRT ) stations are 1 km away but getting a taxi is easy. Rooms are super big and comfortable. Staff are very accommodating and friendly.
Affordable, clean room in a good location. The room is a bit small, but if you are staying for a few days and spend most of the time exploring Singapore, then I guess its not too bad.
Enjoyable stay! Caring attentive staff. Spacious and clean room! Great location to the shopping malls, Mtr and food. Churches nearby too!
The pool really makes this hotel worth it. Otherwise it's just an ok hotel in terms of service and room standard.

I stayed at RELC for almost a week. Overall, I am satisfied with this hotel. I chose triple standard room with three single beds. The room is clean and big. The room has a high ceiling and balcony with street view. The internet connection is fast. The staffs are quite friendly. About the breakfast, not really much variety but the taste was good. This hotel is located about 15 mins walk to orchard shopping area. However, the bus stop is just behind the hotel. Personally, it is very convenient for travelling with bus if you do not like walking. The only drawback from this hotel is taxi. If you are in hurry better you order your taxi by yourself. I had to wait almost one hour at taxi stand. The hotel staff seemed not really helpful about the taxi.

The staff are excellent at Capella. They are attractive, attentive, and welcoming to guests. Rooms are top notch with ocean view - seeing the barges may be a down point. Sunshades, balcony, walk-in closet, big windows, and all the amenities desired. The mini-bar is complimentary with soft drinks, water, and juice. Sunday Brunch is great by the pool side. Hotel Feature Tip: Have a sandwich by the pool and the birds will come.

stay was good and above average. like the location. very near to famous shopping area. near to night street and famous temple. a bit crowded at the lobby. took us some time to check in. but staff are friendly and helpful.

This is our 4th stay at the hotel. We were given rooms at the old wing and you have to pass through the Rose Coffee House to get to the lift to get to the room and the smell of food clings to your hair and clothes. The rooms looked old. The staff seems very cold and there are no doorman to help with the opening of the doors. Look like the hotel is run skeleton staff. This stay is the most dissapointing.
Pleasant, comfortable room, although bathroom on the small side. Good location for business centre and site seeing. Attentive staff.

My partner and I always stay at this hotel every time we are in Singapore. Buffet is definitely the best in Singapore but a little pricey. The service is superb from the time you get to the front where the bell boys welcome you. For the last 1 year this hotel has been under renovation. It's taking a while but it will definitely look great once it's complete.

My partner and I always stay at this hotel every time we are in Singapore. Buffet is definitely the best in Singapore but a little pricey. The service is superb from the time you get to the front where the bell boys welcome you. For the last 1 year this hotel has been under renovation. It's taking a while but it will definitely look great once it's complete.
Good room & worth the money. Great location, good nearby breakfast areas too.

We've stayed here three times this year, and plan to use this hotel each time we are in Singapore. Staff is always very courteous and helpful. They've responded to our request to give us a pool view, and we've always enjoyed this.
Stayed there the third time. Direct access to MRT. Velo City right besides. Nice modern rooms.
i stayed for a few days enroute to europe, have stayed before and i will again

At first they gave me a smelly old-fashioned room, circa the seventies, i was too exhausted to object, but after a wash and a nap, the room cleaning agents had worn off, and the unmistakeable stench of cigarettes was all too evident. Also the view of the carpark did not impress. Its ALWAYS worth making THAT call, I said the smell of cigarettes was unbearable, and the room was disgusting. Then they moved me to a lovely room, no smell of cigarettes, a view of trees and their plant nursery. The decor of the room was much nicer, and I was immensely relieved. The staff were very happy to ove me without fuss. Although, I sat in their cafe area near reception for about 40 minutes, without a single offer of service, in fact the staff seemed to consciously avoid the customers with the old eye avoidance trick. Even when i said "excuse me", I received no acknowledgement at all, and I gave up and went out for afternoon tea. However, the pools are nice, although they told me the main pool was for men only, which I found was rather odd, considering we are in an international hotel, in a secular country, and as it turned out I saw ladies, probably english, swimming, in both the pools. Even in the arab emirates, the pools are for everyone. What is this 'men only?" But all in all I liked the GOODWOOD, great location for all touristing, and after I was moved, I was comfortable with the room.

After an exhausting three weeks on the sub continent I was looking forward to (alas only one night) and i was not disappointed. Thé ever generous staff had a room available for my 7 am arrival for which I am most grateful. Super comfortable room fantastic bathroom and plenty of tea! It was a treat just to walk around and sit in the magnificent lobby. The location is perfect connected directly and undercover to shops and metro. It was also superbly fitted out and quiet despite being on a lower level , giving up a view for something with character and history was a nice outcome The hotel is everything you would expect from ICH.
Hotel Feature Tip: The shophouse rooms are full of character and worth the extra
Always reliable hotel with great location, ease of access to public transport, great staff. A short walk to Clarke Quay. A shorter walk to Boat Quay. All good.

amara hotel is a very old and it needs to be renovated. the bathroom has very bad stained sticking to the floor and the bathing area and its not clean. the hotel in room safe was not working when we check into the room and i have called for room service. they send a technician up, he looked at it and said the battery need to be changed and by the time i came back late in the evening it was still not done. i have to call the reception again and this time they change the battery for the safe. by right this is just a 2 minutes job! i will not stay at this hotel again in my next trip to singapore.
I'm very enjoy to stay at concorde hotel, the room is large and have comfortable bed, and thanks to concoerde hotel for the surprise birthday cake for me when staying there. Thank you to management.
It was without a doubt the highest point of my journey
It's so great , always feel like not enough time and wish to back the Capella soon ..
My friends and I thoroughly enjoyed the stay at the hotel though it was a short stay. Attentive staff and spacious room with bright hotel lobby, making it cosy.
the best hotel in resort world sentosa. have amazing bathroom with a big bathtub and television and the size very very big.
Helpful staff on any enquiry. the place are convenience to get food stalls nearby

I had an amazing experience stay at Hard Rock Hotel. I was flying to Singapore just to see Boyce Avenue Concert, which happened at The Coliseum Hard Rock Hotel. I was handled by a man in the reception desk, who is very friendly. He upgraded me to room with pool view and concert venue. The best thing was i saw Boyce Avenue having sound check from my balcony!! OMG, that was so special!! He just made my day! Surely i will be back to Hard Rock Hotel for my upcoming trip! Thank you Agoda & Hard Rock Hotel to made my trip superrrrr fun! =))

I truly enjoyed my stay there. The bed was divine, the staff were friendly and helpful, and it was in a really convenient location. My only complaint would be the internet tv. It gets interrupted at times.
Nice and has home feel...Great room design and comfortable bed.
very good,friendly staff,rooms where tidy and spotless.best stay ever

Organized the stay at the Capella as a surprise. The Personal Assistant Team was amazing in helping me arrange everything for this surprise and it worked perfectly. The Hotel is located in beautiful grounds. The villas and pool are great. Overall, we had an amazing stay.
very nice hotel and centraly located places comfort room
Fast check in and check out. Friendly staffs. Located near Little India MRT and near a few shopping areas.
Near to perfect hotel if not for a staff name Vera at front desk.

this place is amazing!!! booked on agoda thinking just an average place but turned out to be really nice. Very luxurious feeling when walked in.. place was huge. stayed in superior room with pool view, room was very big & spacious nicely decked out & ryt next to all the shopping on orchard rd.. very walkable distance.. like just round the corner. I loved the pool.. even had a diving side as deep as 3m.. was perfect after a whole days shopping to just chill by the pool..!! Would certainly reccomend & absolutely stay again!!

The swimming pool on the roof top is the highlight of Marina Bay Sands. Quite busy there but an amazing experience to swim on the top of the hotel with a great view. Our room was very big and had nealry everything you expect from a luxury hotel.

I went to celebrate my engagement to my fiance. The hotel staff were amazingly friendly and even gave us a complimentary upgrade to one of their suites. They later surprised us with a complimentary bottle of wine to celebrate the special occasion. The view from the rooms are spectacular - far away from the bustling city. The swimming pool was cosy and was perfect to get some afternoon sun and relaxation. We later went to the club room / library to enjoy some complimentary snacks and port wine. Fabulous weekend and a perfect place for a romantic getaway.
Great and friendly staff. The view from the high floors were great too as I was staying on the 26th floor.
I was staying in orchid club room which have a great service, full day complimentary food & beverages. The room was great, clean and comfortable. Equipped with LED TV, hi speed internet access.

Check-in was a bit slow. The room was amazing and the beds quite comfortable. The mattress was soft & the pillows were the best as they had good texture and hardness. The hotel seemed like a peranakan hotel and had good peranakan food. However, it was a bit inaccessible if you are looking to travel to town or eleswhere via bus or MRT. Overall, amazing place though!
perfect stay.. its a must try hotel, the pool view is unforgetable
my stay at big hotel has been amazing. just the right size comfortable, nice huge bed and good movies selection on tv,
It was a great stay and the place has a very nice ambience
I stay for two nights and it was an amazing and best hotel i ever stayed

The floor to ceiling windows provide a stunning view of the city. The room is quite fine despite being small - it is Singapore, after all. The location couldn't have been better, right on the SMRT. Wish I hadn't had to spend my entire time in Singapore in the bed with the flu... but I will return to this hotel.
Hotel Michael provided a fun and enjoyable vacation for my family.
Amazing, cannot wait to stay there again. It was the best part of out holiday and the service from the staff was just perfect.
great.the room is clean and well furnished. the pathway do not have a bad odour and the staff are friendly. great place to hangout and relax

Dirty room. Upon my check-in, I found toothpaste on the bathroom wall. Friendly staff who are always being helpful, sadly, they are not very efficient. I stayed in the club room, as I were offered a special package to upgrade the room. I were disappointed at the so-called club room. The room smelled and the view was not good at all. Bed is average, not particularly comfortable. I think they are pricey given the quality of the room and breakfast.
Too average to mention. Staffs were not too helpful and have no idea of "attention to details". Housekeeping and in particular front office staffs need a lot of training.

Had a chance to experience a night stay at Grand Park City Hall..Upon checking in, receptionist was readily available to be of service. A 10 minute checking in and everything went smooth. They have a fast free wifi acess and polite staff. SPECIAL mention to Mr. MAHENDRAN to be of help to us especially in assisting us for our baggage. Also to the receptionist Janet for being helpful..We enjoyed staying their just for a night. The hotel is quite old and refurbished rooms.Aircondition system needs to be replaced since thr temp. In the room was quite warm though we set the a/c at maximum cold. Dont like their toiletries though. Bathroom has the average size. If given a chance, il probably be staying in a new hotel at the same area.

Though the service started off very poor due to the fact there were 3 weddings taking place that weekend we were more than compensated by the delays. We got an upgrade to a deluxe sea view suite, which was spacious, comfortable and luxurious, the pool side is relaxation alone and Bobs bar is a great retreat to sit back, relax, enjoy the music and a glass of two of wine. Over all an expensive hotel to stay at, but great for that special someone in your life.

I've stayed here many times and always happy to return. The staff are friendly and accommodating. Great selection of restaurants in and near the hotel. Convenient to public transport and near major shopping and entertainment centers. You really need to try the T Tree Spa at the 916 Salon on the ground flour of the hotel. Amazing.

Enjoyable stay and full of shopping activities in the shopping centres on the Orchard rd area. The location makes it easy for us to shop since it require less time and distance to travel and carry our purchases from the malls to the room. The room size also useful in placing our purchases before arranging them into the luggages.
nice receptionist, understood my will. Good location, nice food court ION in min walking distant.
ordianry, no untowards incidents... which is good for a business traveller.

I've been staying for two days at Intercontinental Hotel. I like the spacious rooms, spacious bed, and big bathroom. Breakfast was good. The only thing that didn't suit me, was the bed a bit too soft for me. but overall my stay has been enjoyable.
Shopping Tip: The hotel is right connecting to Bugis Junction. Which is a nice place to shop with various shops. Across from the hotel, there were a lot of local delicious street food, which is cheap and yummy.

disappointing as hotel is old and not nicely maintained. TV does not has good reception, limited channels. Bathroom very run-down. It's supposed to be a room for 2 person, but toiletries were not sufficient (only 1 set).
The room has no fault. Have to take shuttle bus to have other meals. Large swimming pool. Only downside is that wifi or internet is charagble. Check in only have 2 staff.

Oasia Hotel is a great place to stay, it has easy access to the MRT under the hotel. The staff are always friendly. The club level offers are great breakfast with a Chef to make you something nice. The staff on hand are always happy to assist. The swimming pool is really nice and relaxing. If you do have an opportunity to stay here try the club level, it had all that we needed for our stay.
I did not enjoy my stay at all. Absolutely appalled by the service from the staff, especially the front desk.

I thoroughly enjoyed my stay at Oasia as usual. Service standards remain high, and rooms are remarkably well maintained, given the high volume of guests it receives. Rooms and facilities continue to feel like-new.
Pleasant, comfortable, will be always a place to remember.
asdkjsad sadsajdjskfs fdsfkldskflkldskfsdklfkldslgdkgkfdlgklfkdlgkdfkgkdlfgk;ldf

the hotel was in asian dominated area known as little india which was dleiberately chosen to have asian vegetarian food, the stay was good in the twentieth floor with good view of city, the taxi service was easily available and was alos closer to MRT, the laundry service was also very good

Of all the hotel bookings I've made through agoda.com, this is the first hotel that met with my expectations of a 5-star hotel. I would highly recommend this hotel if you're going to SG for a holiday.

the tv does not have usd or sd card functions. so cannot watch our holiday pictures or movies. there movie selection was very old.plus it was expensive. there food was ok except they forgot out crisp crunchy toast with the soup. we rang about it when it arrived it was very slim horrible toast nothing like it said on menu. romm was very nice plus tv in bathroom.you have to go to another hotel down the road if you want anything printed etc. internet very expensive.
It was average stay. Can find better hotel in Orchard. Bathroom is leaking.
Room is clean and comfortable but the breakfast selection were limited.
Consider average. 2nd time booked thought was given priority but was not since not given high floor and the room i entered was not cleaned with previous owner used and a smell...
Typical hotel stay, nothing special about it. We had to wait for our rooms & it wasn't ready until 4pm. Location was great, it was next door to train station and one of their 1000 malls.

Stay here for 3 night. Spent almost time outside the hotel so me and my wife just back for sleep after long day adventure. Quiet and clean Hotel too. Staff are friendly and Wifi is free. Just ask from reception for the password. The room for Superior is small but the bed is very comfort. Very recommended for budget trip. Locate just few step to Albert food court and Bugis street. The taxi station locate at the back of the Hotel or you can ask the hotel to get you one. To come back here...yes!

Dissapointed with the front desk staff, my sister in law lost her purse when she got down from the taxi on the day of arrival. I requested the staff to allow us to view the CCTV, but was rejected. We want to know how the purse was dropped.. whether in the taxi or at the hotel when she got down. She lost SD500. We also wanted to know the taxi# if the CCTV managed to captured the taxi#....

The room rate was cheaper than most other hotels in Singapore, however the difference was not all that significant, and in terms of the quality of the overall experience I would rather pay 30 or 40 dollars more and stay somewhere where the standard of service is way better. I felt that the shortfall in standard between this hotel and others only marginally more expensive was not worth saving on the small difference in price. On check in the receptionist told us that the buffet breakfast was well worth the price. We went to breakfast on the first day and then never went back. The only thing I enjoyed about this hotel was the bar lounge at the lobby.

RELC International Hotel is located 5 minutes drive from orchard road or 30 minutes walk to orchard road. The reception lobby is quite small but the room is large and quite clean. Waiting for the lift took awhile and I don't know if there is a restaurant or not as I don't have meal at the hotel and don't see any at the reception. However, the price is quite reasonable for the large room.
The hotel is old and run down. Toilet is very small. Receptionist doesn't greet with a smile and was rather rude.

Prices of hotels in Singapore are way over the top so we can't blame Concord for this. But why does a small beer in the Lobby have to cost S$ 15... The 'executive' room was cramped with the extra bed, and it had a 'view' on a blind wall (Is that where they usually put up the 'cheap' Agoda/promotion-customers?). The bathroom had a lot of fungus, and a shower that during day time (after swimming) was either piping hot or cold, but nothing in between. It was very average, considering we paid way over $250 a night (including $65 for an extra bed for our son). This hotel is not living up to the money they charge.

It was pretty average - yet nothing superb except for easy access to metro station. The staffs were not really friendly and the bar was noisy and small. Also packed by people. Have to take a taxi if you want to have a drink at night. No free wifi connection and additional cost is pretty high. Not really recommended for holidays.

The location was great right next to the Mustafa Center for 24/7 shopping, as well as nearby local Indian restaurants all around. Room itself was very average, no toothbrush, shower/bathroom was small, saw a cockroach. Wifi only good for two devices, which doesn't really work too well when you have a laptop and a smartphone and you travel in Couples. Room was fine though, aside from no complimentary water or anything for that matter. Overall, just a very average experience. Would spend a tiny bit more next time to upgrade overall experience.

we checked in grand park city hall hotel expecting that a very good hotel. its a bit of a disappointment when we arrived in the room. we stayed for 2 days and when we returned from going outside on the first day, the room was not clean. (even though we put the make up room sign). we had to follow-up with housekeeping about 3 times and waited for 1 and a half hour before the room was finally cleaned. our hotel window offered no view as it was facing an old building. if we have to recommend, for the same price you can go to the hotel right opposite and the facilities are way better than this hotel.

average experience - some staff were attentive whilst others were lazy, unfriendly. Room were fairly sized with big windows which is a plus. Though some parts of the bathroom was moldy and flooring colour makes it feel dirty. Breakfast is like an American diner with sour coffee. Overall an inconsistent experience
Surprisingly that Accor card to collect point cannot be used due to this booking was done through agent like Agoda. No breakfast was the big lack point considering the high room rate at Ibis.
I was happy that the hotel upgraded my room to a suit. However, breakfast at the VIP lounge was a bad experience as there was only one staff serving.

95% of the customers are indian, very popular with indian tourist, room facilities are very basic and not up to the usual hotel standard. Gym is not fully operated; some equipments has no electric plug. Pool is ok.Non-smoking room still smells of tobacco. towels is thin and of poor quality.Cannot sleep well in the room
K U.

The room was not well equipped. It was clean but sober. Also quite small, which is to be expected in Singapore. Check in took a long time. Location is great, right opposite Chijmes. I would not recommend this hotel unless there is a special rate deal.
Hotel is centrally located within city center, easily assess to local food nearby the hotel, rooms are big & clean, price is slightly expensive.

It was only average. There was a long wait at the reception and the receptionist was not really helpful. I arrived at the hotel at 3pm and was expecting to check in immediately. To my dismay, she told me that I could only check in after 2 hours. I requested to be checked in immediately and she acceded to the request. However, the room was smaller than I expected, instead of a queen bed (which was something which I paid for), I was given two single beds in the room. How nice and thoughtful isnt it? However, to be really fair, the room service did a great job. They were fast and efficient with their service, that makes my breakfast a pleasant one.

For the price paid, its considered value for money except that in my opinion, there is nothing really out of the extraordinary or bad about this Hotel hence i really find it average. Will not consider to stay here again due to the far fetch location from RWS and the main beach areas.

I made a last min booking on that day. Was ask to wait and they are creating. Took them 1hour + to create. Room look ok but there was a bottle of acohol beside/under my bed. Only thing thats good is the location.

Hotel is located in Little India, which is great for 24h shopping at Mustafa and cheap street eats. Across the road is the MRT station, and there are plenty of coffee shop options nearby also. However the hotel interior is beginning to feel tired, and our bathroom floor had not been cleaned at all. Overall, an average choice, but watch for sloppy housekeeping.

Overall we thought the hotel was fairly average, certainly not a four star experience but ok value for money in comparison to other hotels that we checked out. The rooms were a little run down but overall pretty clean. The concierge was very friendly and helpful. The reception staff on the other hand were not so great, there were two occasions where the service experience was very poor. On the first occasion I had come across a self service laundromat on level 6, a sign displayed advised that tokens could be purchased. I subsequently visited the reception desk only to be told that service was not offered and that I should use the laundry service offered through room service ( a very pricey alternative). I again re-iterated to the receptionist that I had seen a sign in the laundromat, but again she told me that the hotel did not offer this service. I was a little fed up so advised her I would revisit level 6 to check the signage again. It was at this stage that I found out the sign advised to visit the concierge desk for tokens. (The concierge desk is approx 5 metres away from the reception desk). On visiting the concierge I managed finally to purchase the tokens. On the second occasion I visited reception to get a summary of our hotel charges (just to make sure we kept track), according to the receptionist it was not possible to get a summary until we checked out! I advised her that we were not requesting a final bill, but simply wanted a balance of the charges, agin she told us that this was not possible until checkout. Yet again we got the impression that the reception desk need to train their staff as this is a fairly common request that should be able to be accommodated for. Very disappointed.

We stayed in a shop house club room for 4 days. Everything was excellent. The clubroom experience was beneficial in many ways, from attentive, helpful staff to amazing high teas, cocktails, canapés and breakfasts.We only had one problem: we didn't want to leave the hotel. We loved the character of the hotel and the well equipped, oh so comfortable room. All the staff throughout the hotel were extremely helpful, no matter what we needed. Nothing was a problem.

My stay at the V Hotel Lavender was quite good. i went to Singapore with my friends who as well stay at V Hotel Lavender. She is the one who recommended V HOtel Lavender to me. And i think she has recommended a good hotel to me. Overall i lovethis hotel.
Great and awesome... such a good place to stay... good environment and easy to find the best local food in town
I stayed over after a chinese wedding dinner. Food was good, the bed was great. Suits me very well. Complimentary parking. Adquate spread of breakfast selection :)
It was an unforgettable holiday I ever had. The hotel was great.
Comfortable from check-in till check-out. Had a great stay there.
Overall was good. Near shopping area. Accessible to public transport. Carpark for guest should be free as its quite expensive to pay daily for a hotel guest.
Awesome nice and had a fun time good food nice pool

It's my second time at M hotel and it will not be my last, awesome room with really clean bed, good service and check in and out was pretty fast. its a good hotel if youre looking for a short get away. overall good

The location of the hotel was very fantastic and awesome. It's very near to a Mrt station. The place is also very near to lots of nice pubs along. The rooms are clean And very extremely spacious. The breakfast was also really good. The selection was really good.

Although the carpark was hard to locate, the hotel stay was amazing. Room service was good, chamberlains came on time as requested. Overall I have no issue with my stay and it was thoroughly satisfying.

I made 2 separate bookings for Friday and Saturday. However, the customer service personnel was able to combine my bookings into one so that I don't have to check out and in again. We received 2 complimentary carpark coupons and unlimited free monorail rides. The only negative thing about the hotel is the super slow wifi in the room. The separate bathrooms was also an issue.
